name: UNRWA
mission: UNRWA USA lifts up the voices, experiences, and humanity of Palestine refugees to secure American support for resources essential to every human being, for the promise of a better life.
theoryOfChange: UNRWA has a published "Strategic Plan 2023-28" which serves as a comprehensive program strategy document. This plan outlines the Agency's ambition, principles, and priorities for delivering services and addressing the evolving human development and protection needs of Palestine refugees. It acts as a roadmap for UNRWA's work, incorporating lessons learned and recommendations from evaluations. The Annual Operational Report 2023 further details progress against the objectives set out in this Strategic Plan and explicitly includes results frameworks and key statistics. Additionally, UNRWA has a "Protection Strategic Framework" that clarifies how the agency delivers its protection mandate, defining protection pillars and outcome areas. The "UNRWA Digital Transformation Strategy (2022 – 2026)" is also a significant component of the Strategic Plan, providing a framework with high-level objectives, initiatives, and performance indicators.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.unrwausa.org/zakat (Source: https://www.unrwausa.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

all_citations.claim: The charity has a 95.5/100 score and a 93.4% program expense ratio.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories.
Programs include food assistance, scholarships, and mental health support.
The organization tracks metrics such as food parcels delivered and scholarship support.
Total revenue reached $32,433,934 with significant outputs in shelter repair and education.
The organization provides university scholarships and mental health support.
The charity offers various donation options and giving methods for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial transparency and direct impact on a high-urgency humanitarian cause. Its Zakat eligibility and low fundraising costs make it a highly efficient choice for donors.
areas_for_improvement: Working capital is limited to 3.9 months, which may impact long-term sustainability during funding fluctuations
High cost per beneficiary metrics due to the intensive nature of direct humanitarian provision

dimension_explanations.alignment: UNRWA USA shows high alignment for donors interested in humanitarian relief, particularly those seeking Zakat-eligible opportunities to support Palestine refugees [2][8]. The organization addresses urgent needs in education and food security, maintaining a strong track record of accountability [1][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through the direct provision of food parcels, university scholarships, and mental health support [4][7]. With a program expense ratio of 93.4%, it maximizes the utility of its $32,433,934 total revenue to serve refugees [1][6].

baseline_narrative.headline: UNRWA USA National Committee provides critical humanitarian relief and advocacy for Palestine refugees through high-efficiency programming and transparent financial management.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 93.4%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries
Exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.05 to raise every $1
Verified Zakat-eligible status with a clear policy for humanitarian distribution
baseline_narrative.summary: UNRWA USA National Committee is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting the human development of Palestine refugees by funding UNRWA programs such as education and food assistance [1][4]. The organization reported a total revenue of $32,433,934 and maintains a high level of financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 95.5/100 [1][6].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial transparency and direct impact on a high-urgency humanitarian cause. Its Zakat eligibility and low fundraising costs make it a highly efficient choice for donors.

areas_for_improvement.context: While the organization tracks outputs, it could strengthen its impact profile by <cite id="14">seeking external evaluations</cite> or tracking long-term outcomes over a three-year period.
To improve its alignment score, the charity could <cite id="15">expand services to underserved geographies</cite> with limited existing nonprofit coverage.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high internal standards for governance and financial reporting as evidenced by audited statements and independent board oversight.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is a Platinum-level Candid participant, indicating a commitment to improving data transparency.
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="14">lack of long-term external impact evaluations</cite> and a relatively high cost-per-beneficiary due to the nature of crisis-zone operations.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data current through 2023 tax year
data_gaps: Employee count not specified in recent filings
confidence.notes: Strong data consistency across multiple third-party and primary sources.

known_gaps: Detailed employee count not in summary data

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors with <cite id="7">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and a focus on high-urgency humanitarian needs in <cite id="1">Gaza and the West Bank</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be further enhanced by <cite id="15">expanding services to underserved populations</cite> within their geographic reach.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="3">95.95.5/100 from Charity Navigator score</cite>, <cite id="13">93.4% independent board</cite>, and <cite id="9">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>.
credibility.improvement: Credibility is already high; maintaining current transparency standards is recommended.

impact.explanation: The organization demonstrates high efficiency with a <cite id="4">93.4% program expense ratio</cite> and <cite id="12">strong board governance</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="14">tracking outcomes over at least 3 years</cite> and commissioning independent evaluations.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Output tracking with clear Theory of Change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Directly funds UNRWA to implement humanitarian programs for Palestine refugees.

rich_narrative.headline: UNRWA USA National Committee provides critical humanitarian relief and advocacy for Palestine refugees through high-efficiency programming and transparent financial management.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide emergency humanitarian relief to Palestine refugees through a highly efficient, Zakat-eligible US-based organization.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill Zakat obligations for Palestinian refugees
Value established partnerships with international agencies like UNRWA
Seek to support education and food security in crisis zones
giving_considerations: Gifts support large-scale institutional programs rather than individual sponsorships
Operations are subject to significant geopolitical volatility in Gaza and the West Bank
Focus is on direct aid delivery rather than long-term policy advocacy
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking small-scale hyperlocal projects or those requiring rigorous academic RCT evidence for every dollar spent.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects consistent tracking of outputs (e.g., food parcels, scholarships) and a clear theory of change, but lacks independent longitudinal impact studies.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: UNRWA USA envisions a world where Palestine refugees thrive, achieving this by funding essential services in education, health, and emergency relief to maintain human dignity until a just solution is reached.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that humanitarian aid effectively translates into improved quality of life and resilience for refugee populations.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The 113.8% revenue growth indicates a massive surge in donor trust and capacity to absorb funds for the ongoing Gaza crisis.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Gaza, West Bank, Jordan, Lebanon, Syria

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite> which significantly exceeds the <cite id="16">peer median of 89.8%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="4">93.4% program expense ratio</cite> and spends only <cite id="6">$0.05 to raise every $1</cite>, maximizing the impact of every donation.
UNRWA USA holds a <cite id="3">95.95.5/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and has earned the <cite id="9">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>.
The charity is <cite id="7">verified Zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically serving the <cite id="8">fuqara and masakin</cite> categories through essential humanitarian aid.

strengths_deep_dive: UNRWA USA's operational model is characterized by high-volume direct provision. In 2023 alone, their funding facilitated the delivery of <cite id="10">35,919 food parcels</cite> and provided <cite id="11">100 university scholarships</cite> to students in need. Their governance is equally strong, featuring a <cite id="12">board of 13 members</cite> with <cite id="13">93.4% independent membership</cite>, ensuring objective oversight of their multi-million dollar humanitarian grants.
rich_narrative.summary: UNRWA USA National Committee serves as a vital humanitarian bridge, dedicated to supporting the human development and emergency needs of Palestine refugees. The organization primarily funds UNRWA programs, focusing on <cite id="1">education, food assistance, and mental health services</cite> across the Gaza Strip, West Bank, Jordan, Lebanon, and Syria. In 2023, the organization demonstrated remarkable growth, reporting <cite id="2">total revenue of $32,433,934</cite>, a significant increase that reflects its expanding role in addressing the humanitarian crisis. Financial stewardship remains a core pillar of their operations, evidenced by a <cite id="3">95.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>. Their efficiency is particularly notable, with a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 93.4%</cite> reported in recent filings, ensuring that donor contributions are directed toward direct service delivery. Furthermore, the organization maintains <cite id="5">exceptional fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending only <cite id="6">$0.05 to raise every $1</cite>. For Muslim donors, UNRWA USA provides a <cite id="7">verified Zakat-eligible pathway</cite> to support the <cite id="8">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> within the Palestinian refugee population, backed by a clear policy for humanitarian distribution.
